reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Emergency Food Assistance to the Remainees in Western Mosul and IDPs families in Ninewa, in Iraq

description.narrative:
Three years of continuous conflict and economic stagnation have impacted nearly every aspect of Iraqi society. More people are vulnerable and in need of assistance now than at any time during the previous years. During 2017, humanitarians estimate that as many as 11 million Iraqis will require some form of humanitarian assistance. This figure represents the aggregate, rather than absolute number of people who will require some form of assistance. In some cases, a single person is counted several times in determining the overall level of need. This reflects the complex reality of Iraq and the changing vulnerabilities many Iraqis are expected to experience during the year. (Humanitarian Needs Overview, Iraq - 2017)
In response, this project aims to provide a life saving intervention through provision of food baskets to 6000 households among the most vulnerable conflict affected people who remain in Western Mosul and to the IDP families in Ninewa governorate. This intervention will target the most vulnerable conflict affected communities with focus on women headed household, people with special needs, households with children under 5, pregnant and lactating women, and elderly people, with lifesaving food assistance.
Islamic Relief Iraq (IR Iraq) has implemented a project of Installation of 1000 tents in Basateen, Shirqat district in March-April 2017 where the capacity of the camp is up to 2500 tents funded by UNOCHA, this camp is mainly done for the people who fled where the number of people in camp is expected to reach 15000 people of which 5000 - 8000 are children. This proposed project will be mainly targeting the 6000 households, equivalent to 36000 individuals (9206 men, 9160 women, 8482 girls, and 9152 boys) in both locations in Western Mosul for those families who remain and for IDPs families in Ninewa.
The food basket will contain the followings: (10 kg Rice, 10 kg Sugar, 5 kg Lentil, 5Liter Oil, 500gm Canned Beef, 850 gm Tomato Sauce, 2kg chick peas, 1 kg beans, 1 Kg Macaroni, 1 kg Black tea, 350 gm Salt ).
The number of targeted households will be 4000 HHs and 2000 HHs in Western Mosul and Ninewa governorate respectively. The food basket has been designed in consultation with the local beneficiaries as per their actual food intake calories and beneficiaries desire.

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
